org.slf4j
Interface Logger

All Known Implementing Classes:
NOPLogger
public interface Logger

The org.slf4j.Logger interface is the main user entry point of SLF4J API. It is expected that logging takes place through concrete implementations of this interface.

Typical usage pattern:

 import org.slf4j.Logger;
 import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
 
 public class Wombat {

   final static Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(Wombat.class);
   Integer t;
   Integer oldT;

   public void setTemperature(Integer temperature) {
     oldT = t;        
     t = temperature;
     logger.debug("Temperature set to {}. Old temperature was {}.", t, oldT);
     if(temperature.intValue() > 50) {
       logger.info("Temperature has risen above 50 degrees.");
     }
   }
 }

This is a reduced version to support CLDC 1.1

Author:
Ceki Gülcü, Marcel Patzlaff
